resource.rights: At the request of the author, this item is embargoed until 2016-06-12

descriptions.description: Abundances of 43 woody plant species recorded in 93 0.05-ha (10 x 50 m) unburned and burned forest plots in the Missouri Ozarks, USA (N = 46 unburned plots, N = 47 burned plots). The plots were located in two state parks: Ha Ha Tonka State Park and Lake of the Ozarks State Park. Abundance was measured as the number of individual stems greater than or equal to 2 cm at diameter breast height (1.3 m). Each row represents the abundance of a species in a plot.
